item.title: Víctor add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Siempre imaginé que el Paraíso sería algún tipo de biblioteca." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "God does not play dice with the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Blind belief in authority is the greatest enemy of truth." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Studs Terkel
item.description: "I always love to quote Albert Einstein because nobody dares contradict him." -- Studs Terkel

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life. " -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Emmanuel Kant
item.description: "He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals." -- Emmanuel Kant

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Yukio Mishima
item.description: "True beauty is something that attacks, overpowers, robs, and finally destroys." -- Yukio Mishima

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Yukio Mishima
item.description: "Anything can become excusable when seen from the standpoint of the result" -- Yukio Mishima

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description:
"The foundation of irreligious criticism is: Man makes religion, religion does not make man. Religion is, indeed, the self-consciousness and self-esteem of man who has either not yet won through to himself, or has already lost himself again. But man is no abstract being squatting outside the world. Man is the world of man – state, society. This state and this society produce religion, which is an inverted consciousness of the world, because they are an inverted world...
Religious suffering is, at one and the same time, the expression of real suffering and a protest against real suffering. Religion is the sigh of the oppressed creature, the heart of a heartless world, and the soul of soulless conditions. It is the opium of the people.
The abolition of religion as the illusory happiness of the people is the demand for their real happiness. To call on them to give up their illusions about their condition is to call on them to give up a condition that requires illusions. The criticism of religion is, therefore, in embryo, the criticism of that vale of tears of which religion is the halo.
Criticism has plucked the imaginary flowers on the chain not in order that man shall continue to bear that chain without fantasy or consolation, but so that he shall throw off the chain and pluck the living flower. The criticism of religion disillusions man, so that he will think, act, and fashion his reality like a man who has discarded his illusions and regained his senses, so that he will move around himself as his own true Sun. Religion is only the illusory Sun which revolves around man as long as he does not revolve around himself." -- Karl Marx

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "In a higher phase of communist society, after the enslaving subordination of the individual to the division of labor, and therewith also the antithesis between mental and physical labor, has vanished; after labor has become not only a means of life but life's prime want; after the productive forces have also increased with the all-around development of the individual, and all the springs of co-operative wealth flow more abundantly—only then can the narrow horizon of bourgeois right be crossed in its entirety and society inscribe on its banners: From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs!" -- Karl Marx

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it." -- Confucious

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "You cannot open a book without learning something." -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "And remember, no matter where you go, there you are." -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Atwood H. Townsend
item.description: "No matter how busy you may think you are, you must find time for reading, or surrender yourself to self-chosen ignorance." -- Atwood H. Townsend

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "It is not the failure of others to appreciate your abilities that should trouble you, but rather your failure to appreciate theirs." -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Do unto others what you want done unto you." -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Lead the people with administrative injunctions and put them in their place with penal law, and they will avoid punishments but will be without a sense of shame. Lead them with excellence and put them in their place through roles and ritual practices, and in addition to developing a sense of shame, they will order themselves harmoniously" -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." -- Confucious

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall." -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "A lion chased me up a tree, and I greatly enjoyed the view from the top." -- Confucius

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I wanted to change the world. But I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Maybe this world is another planet’s hell." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Lao Tse
item.description: "Aquél que obtiene una victoria sobre otro hombre es fuerte, pero quien obtiene una victoria sobre sí mismo es poderoso." -- Lao Tse

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Víctor add a quote by Beethoven
item.description: "Only the pure of heart can make a good soup." -- Beethoven
